reviewText: I recently ordered this video based on the rave reviews it's gotten; plus, I am familiar with the FIRM serious and Tracie Long.  I did enjoy the workout; however, advanced students should know that you really need to use heavy weights to get the workout you're after.  I was expecting it to be much harder, so I went with lighter weights, and it was over before I knew it had begun!  The reps are really quite short, so you'll want to pile on the weights in order to really feel it.  Once you do that, though, it's a great tape and I'm sure I'll be reaching for it often when I am looking for a specifically weight-training video.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of my favorite Firm workouts led by one of the best Firm instructors, Tracie Long.  The workout is 45 minutes (which I consider perfect) and uses dumbells of various weight, a dowel (I use a piece of PVC pipe), and a 14 inch step-up box.This routine is light on cardio and heavy on weight work, as compared to some of the other Firm workouts.  It's tough, but you can vary the level of intensity or difficulty by pyramiding the weights up or down to your fitness level.Tracie Long cues well, gives concise instructions and also demonstrates the wrong form, while meticulously using good form at all other times.Unlike other reviewers, I love the music in this workout and find it rather uplifting and motivational.  The old Firm videos always had great production values, as is the case with this one.This workout leaves me sweaty and feeling worked out but not exhausted or worn out.  Highly recommended.
summary: Excellent Total Body Workout - Heavy on Weight/Light on Cardio

reviewText: it took me a minute to realize i had this tape under the name All weights since around 1998. i am disappointed as for a minute there i thought i missed buying one of tracies workouts. i've said in other reviews for her other videos ( The tortoise and the hare scuplting with weights etc)  i just love tracie long as an instructor. i have lost serious inches due to this fun and tough workout. and i just love also the other firm workouts, they are tough but they WORK.. Thanks!
summary: this tracie long video is the core of my workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Of the other videos I own, you get soooo bored with the cutesy talk after watching the video over and over.  I also don't like when they take time out to demonstrate a move.  The first time is okay, but what about when you do the workout again and again?!  I was a little nervous when the video started (my first Firm tape)The instructor was a little intimidating but after that I realized she was just a no nonsense, get down to business instructor.  You will definately be able to use the video again and again and not get bored.  I was not challenged as much as I thought I would be, however(I'm an intermediate exerciser).  I used medium to light weights and worked up a reasonable amount of sweat but did not need to take a break.  Definately a great tape to have and I will buy more Firm tapes.
summary: One you won't get bored with....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Other reviewers have mentioned the lack of cardio in this workout - it is not designed as a cardio workout, nor is it one of the Firm Classic "Aerobic Weight Training" workouts. Rather it is a focused, well-flowing all weight workout which targets every muscle group. A friend of mine recently described this as the "ideal little weight workout."  If you're a cyclist or runner, this one is perfect for pairing.What I've always loved about MBS is that the workout can be done heavy or light and it is fairly short (approximately 45 minutes). Led by the phenomenal Tracie Long, one of the Firm's top instructors, I find myself reaching for this one out of my collection of 40+ workouts (mostly Firm & Cathe) when I feel the "need" for an all weight workout, yet am not really up to the intensity of Total Body Shaping Mix or Cathe Friedrich. I do use fairly heavy weights (8-20 lb. dumbells and a heavy barbell) and, as usual, with any Firm workout, this tape can be modified to your fitness levels by the amount of poundage you use. Aside from the Firm's tall box presses, this workout could be done with none or light weights by a beginner. Terrific workout for any exerciser - from beginner to advanced.
summary: Superb - One of the best of the Firm!

reviewText: Great for Beginner to Intermediate! Lunges, lunges, lunges, lunges..... oh and they do a very short cardio segment and then..... But at 45 min you can do this tape twice a day! Only complaints are to many lunges (oh, my knees), and too short of a cardio segment. The music is very good, atmosphire is good BUT the best thing is the instructor, Tracie Long, she is the best that I have seen!!!
summary: Great for Beginner to Intermediate! Tracie Long is great!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is not one of my favorite Firm videos, but it's a very good workout that hits all the muscle groups in about 45 minutes.  There are some very brief cardio sections as well for added variety.  Tracie Long who is one of the best instructors that came out of The Firm leads you.  You will need assorted dumbells, Fanny Lifter or stool, and a dowel or broom/mop handle.You start with a brief warmup and stretch, then move right into weight work.  You will see squats, pushups, one arm lat rows, one arm bicep curls w/cheat, leg presses, bicep curls/upright rows, alternating bicep curls, dips with kicks using a dowel, squats/military presses, plies/upright rows w/military presses, french presses, tricep kickbacks, front, side and rear deltoids lifts, dips/lunges, table and bridge work and some ab work.  There are also a couple sets of tall box climbs which really elevate the heartrate and a set of kicks and plyo jumps for cardio.  Lots of the aforementioned moves are done in combination, such as the lunges and dips, where you will lunge forward with one leg and dip backwards with the other, or in a compound fashion, such as the squats and military presses or plies and upright rows.  There is a lots of variety in this workout, including some unique oblique work and floor work for the hamstrings and behind.Tracie Long is a great instructor, some perceive her as being a little dry as she is not as perky as some other instructors.  But I think she does an excellent job, she is good about form pointers and shows you what not to do which is nice especially for those new to weight training.  I would rate this workout as intermediate level, The Firm has billed it as their toughest bodybuilding workout, which I don't necessarily agree with.  It is not a walk in the park, but it isn't impossible to complete either.  Those just starting out need to take is easy and go light on the weights.  I also recommend viewing the workout to get a good idea of the moves as they happen as lots are combined with other moves.Overall, this is a good workout, it packs a lot into 45 minutes.  Recommended.
Title: N/A
